repnme.cdata!:
China - Anning Valley Agricultural
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the China Anning Valley
            Agricultural Development Project were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            negligible to low, the Bank performance was satisfactory,
            and the Borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: 1) an integrated river valley development
            approach proved to be practical and effective in addressing
            multiple development objectives for poverty reduction; 2)
            strong Borrower ownership and effective project management
            are essential for successful implementation; 3) the
            innovation and adoption of new approaches need careful
            preparation and testing; and 4) parallel financing with
            national programs is desirable to up-scale Bank project operations.

repnme.cdata!:
China - Anning Valley Agricultural
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Anning Valley Agricultural
            Development Project aims at increasing the agricultural
            production and marketability in the area, with a particular
            emphasis at reducing poverty. The project fosters the
            effective use of natural resources, through the development
            of mountainous areas and environmental improvement. The key
            components of the project are: a) water resources
            development, consisting of three sub-components -
            Manshuiwan, Huangqiao & Shengli - which include the
            construction of weirs, high dam and canal systems, both for
            irrigation and hydroelectric power stations; b) the
            development of land and technology for crop development,
            aimed at increasing provincial food production; c) orchard
            development to improve the quality and quantity of fruits in
            the project area; d) the sericulture development, designed
            to be market-driven, will increase and improve silk
            production; e) the livestock development aims at reducing
            farm poverty, generating income activity for women as well;
            f) the agro-processing component, provides essential
            linkages among production, processing and marketing of farm
            products; and g) the institutional development component
            will strengthen institutional issues for agricultural
            research and extension, as well as environmental protection.

repnme.cdata!:
Anning Valley Agricultural Development
            Project - environmental impact and social assessment report

abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment (EA)
            report ensures that environmental impacts, as a result of
            project implementation, are in line with the National
            environmental regulations, and in accordance with Bank
            guidelines. The project is not expected to produce
            detrimental environmental impacts in the surrounding areas,
            nor does any component pose an environmental risk.
            Processing plants have limited potential for local water,
            air, and noise pollution, however, procurement
            specifications would include full environmental protection
            measures to contain pollution within national standards.
            Nonetheless, the study reviews environmental aspects in
            compliance with Chinese standards. Combined waste-water
            effluents of processing plants and public buildings, will be
            either discharged to municipal sewers, or, into septic
            tanks, and solid waste disposed on agricultural land.
            Adequate design of boilers, and processing systems, would
            contain air emissions, while procured equipment is in line
            with required noise emission standards. Similarly, all
            chemicals and fertilizers, would be approved by the Bank, in
            accordance with national standards. A social assessment
            summary is included, indicating the project is unlikely to
            cause social, or cultural conflicts among its population,
            and ethnic groups. Economic, political, and social benefits
            are analyzed, in particular, women's constructive force
            in the project area.

docna.cdata!:
Anning Valley Agricultural Development
            Project - environmental impact and social assessment report

display_title.display_title:
Anning Valley Agricultural
            Development Project - environmental impact and social
            assessment report (Vol. 2)

repnme.cdata!:
Anning Valley Agricultural Development
            Project - resettlement action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
This resettlement action plan aims to
            ensure that the standards of living and income levels of all
            project affected persons (PAPS) are improved, or at least
            restored. A comprehensive strategy for implementing land
            acquisition and resettlement requirements under the
            Manshuiwan sub-component is based on the principle of
            "land for land," encouraging introducing
            diversified economic activities in affected rural areas. The
            preferential resettlement policy consists of: tax exemption
            on agricultural products for three years; free irrigation
            water and electricity for domestic use for three years, free
            timber cultivation and sand handling if used to construct
            new houses; equal treatment in distributing farmland, house
            lots, some land for personal use, and job opportunities; no
            charge for children changing schools; free training in
            agricultural production; and a reduction, suspension, or
            exemption from taxes for 3-5 years for those embarking on
            breeding and processing programs. Compensation for land
            acquisition will be based on the average production value of
            lands. Compensation for houses, trees, structures,
            production, and village infrastructure facilities will be
            paid; and replacement costs for some of the infrastructure
            will be contracted for reconstruction. The primary aim of
            the Huangqiao sub-component is to increase income levels.
            PAPs ousted from the reservoir area will be relocated in
            townships downstream; and submerged access roads and power
            supply lines will be restored.

display_title.display_title:
Anning Valley Agricultural
            Development Project - resettlement action plan (Vol. 3) :
            Manshuiwan sub-component
